abstract: Lawyers representing New York State Assemblyman Sheldon Silver are likely to be cautious about asking witnesses about Silver's good character when his federal corruption trial begins; prosecutors have made clear that if defense lawyers broach subject of Silver's character they will open door for them to focus on instances that will raise questions about his honesty and integrity.
lead_paragraph: If the defense team for Mr. Silver, the former Assembly speaker, introduces testimony about the quality of his character, prosecutors would be able to do the same.

headline.main: Sheldon Silver’s Lawyers Confront Risks of Putting His Character on Trial
headline.print_headline: Silver’s Lawyers Confront the Risks of Putting His Character on Trial

snippet: If the defense team for Mr. Silver, the former Assembly speaker, introduces testimony about the quality of his character, prosecutors would be able to do the same.
